intro: Erysimum babataghi, commonly known as the Babataghi wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in early spring. Erysimum babataghi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
